data.title: the ultimate alphabetical code
data.solution:
import sys
import math
j = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
i = int(input())+1
l = 0
while l%26!=25:
    if (l%26==0 and l>0):
        break
    print(j[l%26])
    l+=i
if (l%26==0):
    print(j[0]) 
else: 
    print(j[25])
data.statement: Print a string of letters starting from {{a}}, going up in intervals of [[I]] (being the number of letters to skip), and wrapping around to {{a}} after {{z}}. Continue this up to the point where {{z}} or another {{a}} is reached.

data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> An integer [[I]] for the number of letters to skip.
data.outputDescription: <<? lines:>> A string of letters starting from {{a}}, one letter per line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Print a string of letters starting from a, going up in intervals of I (being the number of letters to skip), and wrapping around to a after z. Continue this up to the point where z or another a is reached.
Input
Line 1: An integer I for the number of letters to skip.
Output
? lines: A string of letters starting from a, one letter per line.
Constraints
1 < I < 10
Example
Input
2
Output
a
d
g
j
m
p
s
v
y
b
e
h
k
n
q
t
w
z
